text: Yochanan Sofer (1923 â€“ February 22, 2016) was a Hungarian-born Israeli religious official and activist. He was the Rebbe of the Erlau dynasty. He was born in Eger, Hungary. After surviving the Holocaust, he continued their legacy by founding a yeshiva and a movement in their name, first in Hungary and then a few years later in Jerusalem. Sofer died in Jerusalem on February 22, 2016 from pneumonia.
